column1: '''Ringló Vale''' was a vale located in [[Lamedon]] of [[Gondor]] traversed by the river [[Ringló]].
The valley was the location of a Gondorian fiefdom. In {{TA|3019}}
column3: son of the Lord of Ringló Vale
column4: led 300 foot-soldiers to the support of [[Minas Tirith]] before the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]].

column1: :Ringló Vale was an area in the region of Central Gondor
column2: located east of [[Lamedon]] in Western Gondor and north of [[Dor-en-Ernil]]. Its emblem was a golden trout on a blue field. During the [[War of the Ring]]
column3: the elderly "Lord Borhador" ruled from the Crossing-Hall in [[Ethring]]
column4: the only settlement. He was assisted by his other son "Arvaethor" in [[Dervorin]]'s absence. The Vale was threatened by [[spiders]]
column7: and the twice-traitorous [[Oathbreakers]] known as the Ruthless Dead. Southwest of Ethring was the [[Warning beacons of Gondor|beacon]] of "Eilendoth".
